snippet: Government efforts to silence a Peking University professor who has criticized Communist rule come as China’s colleges are ambitiously seeking respect abroad as great centers of learning.
abstract: Chinese government's efforts to silence Peking University Prof Xia Yeliang, vocal critic of Communist rule, has thrown into sharp relief the challenges facing elite colleges and Universities in the country; schools are caught between political controls at home and their ambitions to gain international respect.

byline.contributor: Chen Jiehao and Ye Fanfei contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Government efforts to silence a Peking University professor who has criticized Communist rule come as China’s colleges are ambitiously seeking respect abroad as great centers of learning.

headline.main: As China Moves to Lower Professor’s Profile, Colleges Are Seeking to Raise Theirs
headline.print_headline: As China Moves to Lower Professor’s Profile, Colleges Are Seeking to Raise Theirs
